data.event: In 1733, Massachusetts established Bedford as "Narragansett, No. 5" for the benefit of soldiers who fought against the Narragansett Indians in Rhode Island.
The settlement was incorporated as Bedford in 1750, and was named for Lord Russell, the Fourth Duke of Bedford.

event.title: dated 1737 stands on what is now

data.event: A monument dated 1737 stands on what is now known as Station Road (adjacent to Hawthorne Drive), marking the first settlement.
In 1874, Bedford was served by Concord Railroad, and service by the Manchester and Ashburnham Railroad was being planned.
